Question: This merger was partially done because this person admired Anna Howard Shaw, who worked with the AWSA and was a great speaker.
Hints: After her trial this person petitioned the US Congress to remove the fine in January 1874.
Stanton openly criticized this person's stance, writing that this person and AWSA leader Lucy Stone "see suffrage only.
In 1849, at age 29, this person quit teaching and moved to the family farm in Rochester, New York.
